section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of reasonable hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will use best efforts to schedule and perform such maintenance between the hours of 8pm and 8am Eastern Standard Time on weekdays, or during weekends.
explanation: The phrase "reasonable hardware and software maintenance" is ambiguous. The term lacks a clear definition. What constitutes 'reasonable' maintenance is subjective and open to interpretation, potentially leading to disputes between the parties. This creates uncertainty regarding the scope of allowed downtime and could lead to disagreements if the Customer believes the maintenance is excessive or not 'reasonable'.

section: connectivity to the Internet. Specific connectivity details are outlined in a separate service level agreement (SLA).
explanation: The contract references a separate service level agreement (SLA) for specific connectivity details, however, the SLA is not attached to this document. This creates an omission because the specific connectivity details are not available, making it hard to review the full extent of i-on's responsibilities.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term.
explanation: The language regarding renewal is structurally flawed and difficult to understand. The phrase "one (1) or more one (1) month periods" is redundant and doesn't clearly define the renewal terms. It is also unclear whether the renewals are one-time events or continuous. Additionally, it is not specified what happens if the agreement is not renewed.
